Sales Operations Manager, Solutions Engineering
We’re looking for an entrepreneurial and driven Sales Operations Manager to join our Strategy &amp
column2: Operations team to support Snyk’s Global Systems Engineering (SE) team through a period of hyper-growth. The Strategy &amp
column3: Operations team’s mission is to support Synk’s Leadership team in driving hyper-growth by enabling good, efficient decision making, rapid, effective execution, and scale. The position will report directly to Snyk’s Sr. Director, GTM Strategy, Operations and Analytics.

column1: You’ll Spend Your Time
Creating and delivering weekly operations reports and forecasts
Tracking, analyzing, and reporting on SE process KPIs
Delivering actionable insights to leadership to inform decisions to increase SE effectiveness and efficiency
Supporting ad hoc sales analytics and developing new reporting tools stemming from multiple data sources
Assisting SE Management with Annual and Quarterly planning, including SE capacity modeling, coverage models, and quota assignment
Managing assigned projects to drive increased operational efficiency within the SE organization and sales operations
Training teams on how to use our tools (e.g., CRM) most effectively
column2: subsequently collaborating with them on ideas and enhancements to our tools and our overall process

column1: You Should Apply If You
Are agile and enjoy the speed of a fast-paced, highly engaged startup environment
Have sharp analytical skills and an “insight-ready” mindset: you don’t just report the data, you generate insights &amp
column2: provide business recommendations

column1: Are ridiculously easy to work with, with an ability to build strong relationships with a broad set of stakeholders that have diverse interests
Have program management skills and are comfortable multitasking and prioritizing in a fast paced environment
Enjoy acquiring new knowledge and skills and can do so quickly
We’d Especially Love To Hear From You If
Have Bachelor’s degree within a critical thinking field (economics, finance, accounting, operations, etc)
Are proficient in MS Excel/Google Sheets and MS Powerpoint/Google Slides
Have experience with BI tools (e.g., Looker) and/or SalesForce dashboarding
Have at least 4 years of experience working with a SaaS or a technology company in an operational role
Are a self-starter with ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Are an exceptional problem solver, with a demonstrated ability to analyze complex problems and develop solutions

We are distributed across four offices in London, Tel Aviv, Boston and Ottawa, with 10% of the company working fully-remote. We’ve made an organizational commitment to building a strong, effective, distributed company: we form teams across multiple offices wherever possible, and we invest in communication so that we can benefit from each others’ perspectives. As well as an always-on webcam so we can see what’s happening in each office, we make heavy use of video calls, Slack, and some inter-office travel.
About Snyk

Snyk, the cloud native application security leader, has a vision to empower every modern developer in the world to develop fast and stay secure. Only Snyk provides a platform to secure all of the critical components of today’s cloud native application development including the code, open source libraries, container infrastructure and infrastructure as code. Snyk’s security platform is built on an industry-leading proprietary vulnerability database, maintained by an expert security research team, that currently powers strategic partners such as Datadog, Docker, IBM Cloud, Rapid7, Red Hat and Trend Micro. The company works with global customers of all sizes to empower developers to automatically integrate security throughout their existing workflows.

Named to the 2020 Forbes Cloud 100, the definitive ranking of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world, Snyk was also recently recognized by Comparably as the #3 small-to-medium business for Happiest Employees in 2020.
We believe open source software is a force for good, and we’re building Snyk to make it easier for developers who aren’t security experts to stay secure.
For more information and to get started with Snyk for free today, visit https://snyk.io.
About Snyk

Snyk is the leader in developer security. We empower the world's developers to build secure applications and equip security teams to meet the demands of the digital world. Our developer-first approach ensures organizations can secure all of the critical components of their applications from code to cloud, leading to increased developer productivity, revenue growth, customer satisfaction, cost savings and an overall improved security posture.

At Snyk, we envision an inclusive technology industry powering a more sustainable and secure world. Since our founding, Snykers have cared deeply for one another and the developer and security communities as well as the larger world around us. Learn more about our Snyk Impact social and environmental mission and take action with us here.

Snyk's Developer Security Platform automatically integrates with a developer's workflow and is purpose-built for security teams to collaborate with their development teams. Snyk is used by 1,200 customers worldwide today, including industry leaders such as Asurion, Google, Intuit, MongoDB, New Relic, Revolut and Salesforce.
Snyk is recognized on the Forbes Cloud 100 2021, the 2021 CNBC Disruptor 50 and was named a Visionary in the 2021 Gartner Magic Quadrant for AST.

47,2959719617,Director of Growth Marketing,Full-time,,Cambridge Brain Sciences,,Toronto, ON","
About Us

Cambridge Brain Sciences delivers an industry-leading B2B SaaS platform to thousands of customers in healthcare. Our flagship product, CBS Health, is used by clinicians to help improve patient care and clinical decision making when treating patients who suffer from neurological or mental health conditions.
People who succeed at Cambridge Brain Sciences have a sense of urgency, a lot of initiative, infinite curiosity, strong internal drive, and enthusiasm and passion for brain and mental health.
Director, Marketing – Cambridge Brain Sciences

Reporting directly to the Chief Product Officer, you will proactively collaborate with key stakeholders across various disciplines (Leadership, Sales, Product, Customer Success, etc.) to develop and execute marketing campaigns that fuel our growth!

This is a hybrid role and, when it is safe to do so, will require a mix of in-office and remote work. Please note that in accordance with our Company Policy, any successful candidate will need to demonstrate proof of full vaccination against COVID-19.
Who You Are
Are you interested in rolling up your sleeves and building the marketing engine from the ground up? In this role, you will build &amp
column2: own the internal marketing function. You will work closely with and be supported by internal stakeholders &amp
column3: agencies to execute Cambridge Brain Sciences marketing strategy.

column1: You are a self-starter with a strong entrepreneurial mindset. As such, this role will require you to think both strategically and tactically. You will drive and participate in activities such as spend planning, forecasting and strategic planning. At the same time, you will be building &amp
column2: driving the marketing function forward. One day, you may be presenting results to the organization, and the next, you may be writing or editing creative content!

column1: We are looking for an expert collaborator and communicator who is able to promote &amp
column2: champion marketing throughout the organization. You understand that the key to your success is building great working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

column1: Your Role

Develop a deep understanding of Cambridge Brain Sciences clients to i) develop insights-based marketing plans, and ii) help inform other critical decisions (e.g., messaging or channels) that help us reach both new and existing clients.
Develop an acquisition experimentation framework and execute insight-based tests and campaigns across multiple channels to find new and scalable acquisition channels

Manage, optimize and grow new or existing acquisition channels that drive high quality leads—such as, but not limited to, conferences (or other community-based marketing approaches), digital marketing, SEO.
Independently design and create high-quality email nurture campaigns (from journey mapping to content to implementation in Pardot).

Establish strong relationships with key members of the sales and revenue operations teams, working hand-in-hand to design and execute processes that effectively drive marketing leads through the sales funnel.
Own and optimize our website for inbound lead generation and maximize the website's potential for persuading visitors to take the next step.
Work with team members to build standard B2B SEO content and sales collateral including webinars, product videos, white papers, and other relevant materials as required.
Create and implement processes to measure campaign performance and channel ROI metrics through the entire marketing funnel.
Your Background
You are a strong &amp
column2: enthusiastic communicator (written, verbal and listening).

column1: You are analytical and obsessed with measuring success through all areas of the marketing funnel, from campaign performance to lead conversion.
Collaboration comes easy to you. You have demonstrated experience working closely with sales teams to deliver results!
You have demonstrated experience growing new acquisition channels in a B2B organization.
You have a strong understanding of sales and marketing metrics and relentless attention to improvement through iteration and optimization.
For you, SalesForce reporting is a cinch. You understand how to find, use and manipulate data.
You are a creative thinker with strong opinions about the details of executing excellent marketing campaigns (asset design, copywriting, etc.).
You may have published content relevant to marketing, technology, healthcare, or other best practices.
You approach your work as a leader.
Though not necessary, experience in Healthtech or other related product organizations would be an asset.
Working at Cambridge Brain Sciences

Our team is focused on doing great work with great people and engaging with great customers who are passionate about brain health. Each member of our team enjoys flexible working hours, flexible working environment, healthcare benefits, and activities that bring our team together every week – even during this working remote world we live in. We also take a break as a company at the end of each year and close for a few well-earned days of rest. We are excited about the future of our company and the engagement we have with our customers every day.

At Cambridge Brain Sciences we are building towards a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace to empower and create access and opportunity for all. Our leadership and everyone on our team is committed to fostering an environment where you feel respected, supported, heard, and valued. We work hard to ensure everyone can reach their full potential.

Cambridge Brain Sciences. is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, and disability, or other legally protected status. We are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). Cambridge Brain Sciences will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us directly.

48,2946294663,Director of Customer Experience and Success,Full-time,Director,iLobby® Visitor Management,Software Development,North York, ON","

As a Director of Customer Experience and Success, you will be responsible for leading our Customer Success Team. You will increase our customers lifetime value and provide an exceptional customer journey by ensuring successful use of the product. Moreover, as a Director of Customer Experience and Success you will be instrumental in growing the customer base through engagement and valuable customer insights which will enhance sales and marketing efforts. In this role you will be the voice of the customer and work with leadership and department heads to communicate this vision and improve overall company success!

This position is for a senior level individual with a sales management background, an understanding for operational and client support management, and an ability to bridge all areas to accomplish success in business growth. As Director IT Transformation and Governance, your role will be to lead the transformation of IT Enterprise Governance, a group, to a product-centric approach. The IT department is responsible for a large portfolio of business applications that cover areas likefinance, sales, human resources, procurement and security.

Who We Are

Centurion Asset Management Inc. is a recognized leader in the Investment and Property Management industries. Providing quality investments and housing for all its clients, our experienced team comprised of more than 280 Employees is a core component of Centurion’s success since 2003. Centurion Apartment Real Estate Investment Trust (“REIT”) owns more than 11,000 multi-family apartment units and student housing beds across 28 cities in Canada and the United States. Since day one, our goal has been to provide Residents and their families with clean, safe, and comfortable homes. The REIT provides investors an opportunity to invest in a diversified portfolio of rental apartments and student housing properties, as well as mortgage and equity investments in property developments, across Canada and the United States and participate in the profits derived from them. Centurion Financial Trust (“CFiT”) is an income and growth-oriented trust that invests in a diversified portfolio of debt investments that include but are not limited to mortgages, opportunistic real estate developments, and corporate debt. Investors pool their funds to invest in mortgage and growth-oriented credit opportunities and participate in the yields from interest income and net profit from equity.

The Research Director, High Tech Advisory is responsible for delivering research content and advisory services on marketing, product management, and sales best practices, targeting the technology provider market. The Research Director contributes to the SoftwareReviews Advisory research agenda in their domain, develops methodology-based research content as well as market-leading insight and thought models, and provides advisory services to our research members (clients). The Director, Research will also build thought-leadership by sharing and presenting our research and insights via conferences and through virtual methods.
Responsibilities

Deliver industry best practices guidance on marketing strategy, go to market plans, and product marketing tactics leveraging your background, ongoing and new research, and synthesis of SoftwareReviews data.
Contribute industry leading thought leadership content around marketing and product management best practices in the following areas:
Product marketing trends and best practices
Branding, positioning, communications, and social media strategies

SEO, and content marketing strategies
Best practices for demand gen and digital marketing

Support the sales team in acquiring additional advisory clients.
Provide proactive thought leadership and new ideas not “asked for” on behalf of the client’s membership.
Drive renewals and upgrades of SoftwareReviews Advisory members through the delivery of key engagements including research, inquiry calls, and ½ day strategic workshops.

Company Description

Dedicated to telling stories and creating experiences, Indigo is always looking for bright, energetic and customer-focused people who can help bring our exciting mission to life in one of our more than 150 Indigo, Indigospirit, Chapters and Coles stores across Canada. We offer a variety of exciting opportunities at our retail stores, distribution centres, and home office for people who share our passions and want to be part of a dynamic and enriching culture.
Who We Are
We love books and all things beautiful
We are Canada’s Cultural Department Store
Books are our heart and our soul and Great Books are JUST the Beginning…
We Play By The Following Rules
We exist to add joy to our customers’ lives each and every time they interact with us and our products
Our job is to create joyful moments for our customers
We treat each other the way we’d treat a valued friend
We inspire each other to do our best work
We seek to ignite creativity and innovation every day
We give back to the communities in which we operate
Job Description

You cultivate an environment that promotes authentic best-in-class employee and customer experiences and are guided by our culture and our mission of adding joy. Your role as a General Manager is one of collaboration, innovation, inspiration, support, and coaching and in doing so, you help to create and sustain a high performing culture focused on delivering sales and profit goals. Your store models operational and visual excellence. You consistently role model the Indigo Beliefs and are a leader that sets examples for your team to follow.
What You’ll Do
Talent
Support and empower team to make decisions, creating a highly engaged and high performing team
Develop a high-performing leadership team that is accountable for creating a best-in-class employee experience
Develop internal talent

Promote a Story Telling culture fulfilling our goal to enrich the lives of our customers.

Goals and Objectives
Gain alignment with Regional Director on store specific goals and objectives for fiscal year
Responsible for the financial success of the store, ensure it is well-run, well-merchandised and well-staffed
Ensure teams drive best-in-class employee engagement and net promoter scores

Actively engage in community-based marketing and events to grow sales and strengthen community ties

5+ years of management or leadership experience with demonstrable skills and success in leading and developing others

At Indigo, we are committed to our communities, our customers, and each other

59,2910230826,Sales Program Manager,Full-time,Mid-Senior level,Quark Expeditions,Travel Arrangements,Toronto, ON","
Some travellers stand at the water's edge, look out into the distance over the expansive ocean and wonder:
“How far away is that point on the horizon? How long will it take for me to get there?”
And then there are those of us who, upon gazing at a far-distant vista, ask instead:
“But what’s
beyond
that point on the horizon? What’s out there that I
cannot
see? That’s where I
really
want to go.”

Today, we carry the spirit of the great explorers, we Go Bold, we Go Together and Go for New. Polar travel is Quark Expeditions, and all of us at Quark Expeditions are committed to creating and delivering life-changing experiences for our clients. We draw on our unparalleled polar expertise to profoundly transform people’s sense of themselves — and of the world around them.
AND TO ALWAYS, ALWAYS GO BEYOND
The opportunity:
Quark Expeditions is looking for an experienced, dynamic,
Sales Program Manager

on a 1 year contract (with opportunity for permanent), to organize and coordinate activities and resources in support of the global sales team including managing, planning and reporting on programs, projects and sales enablement tools and activities from conception through implementation.
In conjunction with the Global Partnership Director, the Sales Program Manager will support the key strategies and tactics of achieving indirect revenue goals, globally.

Additionally, this role will support the outside sales team with a range of lead generating and business development projects in the B2B channel, including but not limited to, sales enablement tools, lead prospecting, trade focused training opportunities, account qualification, and event follow up.

The Sales Program Manager will contribute and assist with the trade database growth initiatives, supporting Quark Expeditions' strategic 5-year plan. Additionally, this role will have business development opportunities in select markets, providing growth opportunities that support long term career advancement.
The successful candidate must be able to demonstrate a strong ability to coordinate the production of sales tools, in addition to being able to manage content for multiple platforms and channels.
What you will be doing:

Leads the development/management of multiple detailed sales project plans in the appropriate tools that defines the scope, deliverables, resourcing, and schedule that supports business goals in collaboration with business and technical teams and other key stakeholders. (Ie. Season launches and in-market promo updates)

Work collectively with IT and other key stakeholders on Salesforce data updates, (including list uploads to ensure trade database is clean and on track for growth goals), dashboards, reporting, event calendars, emails templates and tradeshow campaigns
Lead, manage and maintain the content on the variety of trade sales communication channels and tools including the Partner Resource Centre (PRC) and PolarPro
Manage and build process for sales optimization of prospecting tools such as taConnect, in addition to managing the taConnect budget and reporting on Open Rates and Clicks
Maintain and update all Sales resources on Sharepoint to ensure accuracy and relevancy
Support Marketing with Marketing Opt-In Data Hygiene, Tradeshow/Event Customer Journey
Provide assistance to Global Sales team Master Weekly Data Hygiene (regions/affiliation) and ongoing data management and tracking

Assist Global Sales Team with the preparation and follow up details of select sales events including conferences (ie. Virtuoso Travel Week), trade and consumer events (ie. London Cruise Show) including Salesforce data entry
Coordinate logistics for outside sales events, assisting with invitations and itinerary
Inputs data/lists/leads from events including webinars, conferences, consumer and trade events
Liaises with the Global Sales Manager and Global Client Experience Manager as needed (e.g. FTRC creation, customer service letters, event planning for trainings and social outings)
What are we looking for:
Experience with agile project management and process improvement methodologies
Knowledge of Smartsheet or similar project management tool
Base understanding of business development and indirect revenue channels
Persuasive, encouraging, motivating and detail oriented
Strong organizational, presentation, interpersonal, and communication skills
Must have a strategic mindset and understand how functions within your role might impact other areas of the business
Data-driven, understands how to develop analytics through revenue and performance data
An educational background in travel and tourism or marketing is an asset
Good understanding of Microsoft Office 365
Experience with content management systems (e.g. SharePoint) is an asset
Experience with graphic design programs (e.g. Adobe InDesign) is an asset
Ability to speak French and/or German is an asset
Previous Salesforce experience is required

Are you a self-starter, driven by exceeding quotas, ensuring your customers receive the best possible experience, you have a keen interest in the Polar regions or adventure travel? If this, is you, we'd love to hear from you! Apply online with your CV

60,2955739992,Assistant Executive Director,Full-time,Mid-Senior level,Revera Inc.,Hospitals and Health Care and Hospitality,"Regina, SK","
Description

Revera is a leading owner, operator and investor in the senior living sector. We offer seniors’ apartments, independent living, assisted living, memory care and long term care. We understand how to create the best experience for people living in a Revera home. We believe everyone should have the opportunity to live a life of purpose, and we create environments that make that possible.

Our mission is to celebrate the human spirit in every way possible – and that applies to both our residents and our employees. There’s a lot that goes into being a member of our team – and there’s a lot that you’ll get out of the experience too. We go the extra mile to ensure that each member of our staff feels safe, secure, enriched and empowered in their role. So that everyone under our roof is given the opportunity to thrive, grow and make the most of every day.

Vaccines are a proven, safe and powerful weapon in our battle against COVID-19. Now that vaccines are widely available and recognizing that many of our staff are already vaccinated, vaccination will be a condition of employment for new hires, except when impossible due to legitimate, established exceptions.
The vaccine must be a
two-dose COVID-19
vaccination series approved by Health Canada
This is one more important step to protect both our residents and staff as we continue to battle this deadly virus.

Reporting to the Executive Director, the Assistant Executive Director works in collaboration with the Executive Director to ensure that the overall management and operation of the Retirement Residence provides high standards of service and value to our residents within, profit and margin expectations, and in a manner consistent with Revera's Retirement vision, mission and guiding principles.
Key Responsibilities
To collaborate with the Executive Director to select, orient and monitor the performance of departmental and program managers
To conduct annual performance appraisals in collaboration with the Executive Director
To collaborate with all departmental managers in the recruitment and orientation process of all new and potential new hires.
To participate in the development of the residence annual operating and capital budgets and ensure conformance to approved budgets on an ongoing basis
To establish residence goals and objectives in conjunction with the Executive Director and ensure that these are met within available budgetary and fiscal resources, and appropriate time frames
To administer collective agreements on a day-to-day basis and, together with the Executive Director, represents the company in the grievance and collective bargaining process
To share joint responsibility with the Executive Director and Sales Consultant for all sales and marketing functions of the residence to optimize occupancy
In conjunction with the Sales Consultant, Director of Health and Wellness too conduct community and hospital outreach
To develop and maintain strong community relationships to maximize the availability of potential residents and to obtain feedback with regard to the services required
To meet with resident's families to resolve issues
To work in a position of trust with vulnerable adults (residents)
To uphold and promote the organization's values and philosophy relating particularly to ethics, morality, and integrity as set out in Revera's Code of Conduct
To complete other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Certificate / Degree in Business, Sales, Hospitality Management, Health, and / or Social Services
Minimum of three (3) year relevant management experience, preferably in a retirement residence, hotel, or other hospitality industry setting along with working in a unionized environment.
Must possess strong leadership abilities with proven skills of leading a team.
Solid understanding of business planning processes and key business metrics to be achieved
Property management and maintenance experience is an asset
Sales and marketing experience is preferred to drive superior performance/results
Thorough understanding of effective HR practices and policies
Must possess good written and oral communication skills with the ability to effectively supervise the activities of department managers
Must have demonstrated sound financial knowledge and understanding of how decisions can affect/impact results (NOI, operating margins, Occupancy, REVPAS)
Computer proficiency (Microsoft Office applications)
Must provide a complete and current (within six months) Vulnerable Sector Check (including a Criminal Background Check) or be willing to obtain one
Revera is committed to ensuring that all employment practices are inclusive. As an organization we are committed to providing and arranging accommodation for candidates upon request.
Please Note: If you are a current employee of Revera and have Employee Self Service (ESS) on Workday, please apply to this job via the Workday application.

62,2947082701,Sr Solution Consultant, Embedded Analytics",Full-time,Not Applicable,Visier Inc.,Software Development,"Vancouver, BC","
Overview

Visier is the leader in people analytics. We are passionate about a 'people first' approach to business strategy and our addictive technology is transforming the way that organisations make decisions. Recently closing a hugely successful funding round and a landmark $1b valuation, Visier is embarking on an incredible phase of its 11 year growth Journey. Part of this growth includes accelerating the growth of our partnerships business and we are looking for a talented Sr. Solution Consultant to grow and scale within our pre-sales team.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Partner Presales, Embedded Analytics you’ll be responsible for working alongside our sales team to evangelize, design, propose and demonstrate the business value to our prospective partners. We help organizations answer questions that shape business strategy, provide the impetus for taking action, and drive better business results. On a daily basis you’ll be creating vision with our partners and internal teams, mesmerizing data geeks with our solution and showing how Visier creates both business and technical value.
You will be able to work out of your home office anywhere in the United States or Canada.
What You'll Be Doing...
Ensure excellence in the execution of the technical work streams on sales opportunities, from product demos to InfoSec conversations to product packaging
Make it easy for prospective partners to understand the value of the Visier platform, solutions and services
Develop and maintain excellence in the demonstration of Visier’s expertise in people data and domain

Strategize with the sales team on discovery and delivery of world-class presentations to multiple audiences where you explain and show Visiers value proposition and differentiation to solve current business problems and drive people analytics strategy
Assist the Sales team to Respond to RFIs/RFPs including answering functional and technical questions about the Visier solution
Partner with the Embedded Solutions and Delivery teams to ensure post-sales success
Partner with our Product and Solutions teams to understand our roadmap and position innovative and differentiated capabilities
What You'll Bring To The Table...

63,2955737642,Sr. Business Advisor,Full-time,Associate,CIBC,"IT Services and IT Consulting, Banking, and Financial Services","Hamilton, ON","
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com
Job Description
What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be reporting to the Director, Business Banking, the Senior Business Advisor role provides new and existing clients with an exceptional client experience to support CIBC’s vision of being a leader in client relationships and increasing client loyalty. The role helps clients to meet their immediate and long term business and personal goals by understanding client needs and/or identifying opportunities to further deepen the CIBC relationship. In addition to sales, this role supports clients’ day-to-day business and personal cash management needs by processing transactions, balancing cash holdings according to CIBC policies and procedures and addressing and resolving client concerns. The emphasis is on ensuring clients’ business and personal - related investments, financial and credit needs are met by providing a comprehensive business banking offer or by making a formal introduction to the appropriate Business Banking colleagues. Success in this role will require frequent collaboration with experts in all areas of CIBC to ensure client needs are met by the most appropriate expert. You’ll proactively manage and grow your portfolio by deepening client relationships with new and existing clients that require multiple complex business solutions including Cash Management. You will seek opportunities for new client acquisition through referrals and partner relationships with Banking Centers to deliver current financial products and solutions for the Small Business market segment.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. To successfully perform the work, you’ll be on-site full-time. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.
How You’ll Succeed

Business Development: Understand your local market and potential client base and create a comprehensive sales plan to acquire new clients. You will use your strong relationship building and networking skills to build connections, generate opportunities, and deliver bottom line results. You will leverage CIBC’s wide range of small business solutions to provide a needs-based approach that will result in satisfied, loyal clients and increased referrals.

Client Engagement: Focus on each client experience and connect on a personal level to make every interaction meaningful. You will deliver trusted advice and financial solutions to meet client needs and cultivate your network to establish new client relationships.

Community Involvement: Attend local events and participate in marketing and outreach activities. You will grow your network to create lasting connections that will generate future small business opportunities.
Who You Are

You can demonstrate experience in Business Banking. You have 2+ years’ experience in Business Banking and have a strong knowledge of cash management products and services as well as knowledge of business cash flow and financial analysis in order to assess and deliver on potential new business opportunities. You also have an established network in the local business community.

You’re a certified professional, You have current accreditation and good standing in The Canadian Securities Course (CSC)/Canadian Investments Funds Course (CIFC) OR you are willing to obtain MFDA license within 90 days of hire.
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.
You’re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.
You act like an owner. You thrive when you're empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
You’re driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day
column2: a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

column1: What You Need To Know

CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

Hamilton-Commerce Place
Employment Type
Regular

64,2959238629,"Lead Sales Engineer, CBS - West USA",Full-time,Not Applicable,GRUNDFOS,"Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, Machinery Manufacturing, and Staffing and Recruiting","Oakville, ON","

Grundfos is seeking a Senior Sales Engineer to join our Commercial Building Systems team. The Senior Sales Engineer is responsible for the profitable growth in market share through the maintenance, monitoring and development of Grundfos products, services and customer base within the market segment. Responsible for sharing knowledge and opportunities outside of the designated market segment to drive sales and profitability across GPA/GNZ. Relocation for this position cannot be supported and qualified candidates must have authorization to work in the USA without support.
Why Grundfos?

At Grundfos, we dare to do things that others cannot or dare not do. Our skills commit us to pioneer solutions to the world’s water and climate challenges and improve the quality of life for people. We believe innovation is not only a business opportunity, but an obligation. And what really matters to us is not short-term profit, but the impact we make. By becoming part of our united powerful team, you too can drive this change no matter your role.
What is the job about?
Development of a designated customer base including preparation plans, budgets and promotional activities.
Drive focus markets with Selected Accounts.
Develop and execute business development activities with selected accounts including but not limited to promotional activities, launch initiatives, brand positioning and new application areas.
Identification and development of new business with the potential to use Grundfos products and services.
Identify and exploit opportunities to implement Value Added Services.
Achievement of agreed marketing objectives, sales volumes and contribution targets.
Provide technical support to dealers, Consultants and end users ensuring specification and correct application of Grundfos products.
Provide technical assistance and segment support within the local office as required.
Assist with the preparation of segment based budgets and plans relating to Key Account activities.
Participate in market research and preparation of reports as required.
Implementation of the company and segment based sales strategy.
Utilise Sales Excellence tools ie
column2: SAP CRM to maintain customer interactions, opportunities and quotations

column1: Ensure all reporting is accurate and presented within an acceptable time frame e.g. expenses.
Responsible for expenditure related to the customer based in accordance with company policies.

At the discretion of the Sales Director –Distribution and / or the Channel Sales Manager be involved in coaching and mentoring Distribution Account Managers and where appropriate be involved in performance and development dialogues.
Any other reasonable duties as defined from time to time.
What do you need to apply?
Qualified candidates will preferably have a Bachelor’s Degree, as well as 3 to 4 years of relevant work experience.
Experience and industry knowledge in the commercial building space.
Ability to lead processes or projects.
Solid knowledge of the Hydronics Systems, Pumps, plans, processes and activities within the function area of commercial building space.
Strong ability influence others.
Possess a great understanding of the relevant systems, local laws and regulations where applicable, for the commercial building space.
If you would like to dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, please visit us on linkedin.com/company/grundfos or youtube.com/user/grundfos .
We look forward to hearing from you.
It is Grundfos policy to provide equal employment opportunity to all it employees and applicants regardless of: race,
color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, physical or mental disability or veteran status.

66,2882844880,Account Executive Mid-Market,Full-time,Mid-Senior level,SysAid Technologies Ltd.,Software Development, Computer Networking Products, and Computer and Network Security","Toronto, ON","

SysAid is a service automation company delivering software for organizations that want to get more done. Our SaaS ITSM (IT Service Management) and Asset Management solutions serve more than 5,000 customers across the globe. We do the heavy lifting for IT and anyone delivering services in the digital workspace, by leveraging automation, analytics, and AI.
As a Strategic Account Executive
at SysAid, you will be a critical member of a high-growth sales organization that will play a key role in helping customers evolve their service management capabilities.

At SysAid, our Mid Market customers are defined by organizations with over 1000 employees who manage their own IT and infrastructure. You will be responsible for managing prospects from lead to close, including pain recognition, business impact, decision-making processes, and timeframes.

You’ll have the opportunity to own your success and execute with the support of a team propelling you forward. You'll be working with smart and energetic people, taking a class-leading product to market, and helping your customers deliver mission-critical projects. A rewarding experience for any growth-oriented sales professional.
Things to know about this role:
SysAid sells strategically to low-to-mid enterprises, mostly in North America, Europe, and the UK).
Our route to market is a mix of direct and indirect (channels).
Around 30% of the pipeline for this role will come inbound.
The balance is generated through BDR-led outbound.
Our average sales cycle in this segment is 5-6 months.
The average annual contract value is $25k.
Our key verticals are healthcare, education, manufacturing, government, and industrial.
What will you do:
Understand customer requirements on both the business and technical levels.
Presenting and communicating at the Director level and higher.
Map out accounts, by identifying champions and influencers, and leverage those relationships to gain access and influence with Decision Makers/IT Executives.
Clearly articulate and demonstrate our value proposition, creating excitement and enthusiasm among prospects.
Identify competitive threats and handle them appropriately.
Provide an exceptional customer experience.
Lead customers through an end-to-end sales cycle in collaboration with pre-sale engineers.
Forecast with accuracy.
Exceed your quota.
Qualifications:
5+ years selling and closing SaaS/B2B sales.
You’re willing to be personally accountable for pipeline health, conversation, and opportunity generation.
You’re experienced in system-based selling, the use of proven methodologies (Sandler, Meddicc).
You’ve got experience managing a sales cycle from business champion to C-Level.
You’re on your way to mastering negotiation and closing techniques with procurement and management teams.
You’re familiar with CRM and sales automation software.
You’ve got strong listening and presentation skills.
You’re comfortable running a high-level demo of a solution on your own.
You’ve got a track record of over-achieving quotas in previous roles.
You’re comfortable with a busy schedule
column2: can multitask, prioritize and manage your time effectively.

Job Description
We are seeking a Marketing Manager, Sales and Product to join our team in Winnipeg or Toronto.

Reporting to the Director of Product, Sales and Client Experience Marketing, this role plans and leads all elements of product and sales marketing campaigns and promotions that drive sales and client retention. The Marketing Manager has a passion to understand customers needs, their beliefs and develop winning marketing strategies rooted in bringing value to our customers

Initially the role will focus exclusively on the launch of a new health rewards platform. Partnering across the organization, the Marketing Manager will developing strong working relationships both within the marketing team but also with business partners ranging from sales teams to senior leaders.
The Marketing Manager, Sales and Product will:
Set strategy to launch new and extend existing products, features and services in People Corporations offering.
Own from concept through to tactical execution and measurement all elements of launch campaigns.
Understand wide breadth of products, features and services that are technically complex and develop positioning that addresses the customer’s needs and beliefs.
Extend launches through paid, earned, owned and social media.
Build strong relationships with internal customers across the organization, especially Distribution.
Work closely with product specialists and project stakeholders to ensure you have a solid understanding of the project and can deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Present creative solutions to internal customers to illustrate concepts and gain feedback.
Manage projects to come in on time and on budget.
Measure and report on the success of marketing campaigns via KPIs.
To be successful as a Marketing Manager, Sales and Product with People Corporation, you will need:
Proven track record to set and execute B2B product and sales marketing strategies in an environment with multiple stakeholders and technically complex products.
Creatively leverages digital and marketing technology to execute marketing strategies.
Demonstrate an understanding of the needs of the customer (Plan sponsor &amp
column2: Plan member), their beliefs and how to address them with value driven marketing strategies.

column1: Able to drive clarity and alignment amongst stakeholders.

Demonstrate strength in planning and organizing the actions and priorities of others (and self), including managing, and coordinating tasks, project plans according to approved principles and within agreed parameters.
Use time and resources effectively to achieve desired results. Have determination in the face of obstacles to set and meet challenging targets and deliver the required results.
Demonstrate a high level of accountability, reliability, adaptability, and innovation in accomplishing day to day work and long-term goals.
Foster open communication, active listening, and value all opinions.
Act in a respectful manner to influence an outcome, impact, or effect.
Seek to understand and build on differing perspectives of others to enhance team efficiency and quality outcomes.
All-star candidates will have:
Post secondary education in marketing or equivalent combination of education and experience.
5-7 years’ experience in the areas of Marketing ideally in B2B.
Strong Marketing experience and knowledge related to Financial Services/Insurance ideally in Group Benefits or Group Retirement.
In depth knowledge of different digital marketing channels.
Hands-on experience with SEO, SME and Google Analytics.
Proven innovative track record of content management and creation.
Proven experience seeking and acting upon customer feedback and research.
Ability to inspire a culture of partnership with internal/external customers to create mutually beneficial processes, products and services.
Ability to collaborate with others (internally and with partners) in changing, expanding or creating new processes/products/services to produce customized, converged solutions for a specific market.

Learn by working alongside our experts
Extended health care and dental benefits

A suite of Health &amp

70,2955569911,Reporting Specialist, eCommerce",Full-time,Associate,Reprise Digital,Marketing Services,"Greater Toronto Area, Canada","
Position Summary

As the global performance marketing agency of Mediabrands, we are obsessed with building and accelerating Customer Flow, the continuous movement of customers along the path to purchase journey. We do this by unifying our digital craft experts which include search, social media, SEO, eCommerce, content creation and strategy under a single operating system with a consultancy lens.

Our expert team of specialists deliver integrated initiatives that help the world’s leading brands connect to the people who drive their business forward – efficiently and effectively. Reprise is headquartered in New York with over 60 offices around the world.
We are currently recruiting for the position of
eCommerce Reporting Specialist
to support the Reprise Commerce team, a specialty unit within Mediabrands Canada designed to support brands across their end-to-end eCommerce needs.
Reporting into the Director of eRetail, the
eCommerce Reporting Specialist

is responsible for providing customized reporting and insights for an assigned top tier client, including managing and executing content best practices to accelerate the brand’s digital shelf presence online across key eRetailers in Canada. The role will also be responsible for supporting stakeholders including directors and business managers, by providing insightful data analytics to help guide strategic client recommendations that will optimize their key eCommerce initiatives.
Key Responsibilities
You will be the main agency lead working cross-functionally with an assigned client and their stakeholders to help deliver on digital shelf content key performance indicators (KPIs) including:

Prepare, analyze and communicate reports to the assigned client’s cross-functional teams regarding status and results of their eCommerce visibility and conversion metrics across multiple eRetailers, in adherence to defined global digital shelf standards.
Establish rapport and communicate directly with eRetailers to address outstanding content gaps and verify asset execution on behalf of the client.
Collaborate with the Reprise Director eRetail in reporting KPI trends, provide education and identify opportunities to further impact and improve upon online merchandising strategy and workflow
Additional Responsibilities:
Develop and implement eRetail customized audits to identify areas of opportunity for clients within the full spectrum of eCommerce: Demand Forecasting, Sales &amp
column2: Retail Performance, Operations &amp
column4: Experience.

column1: Must be comfortable leveraging multiple sources of data to analyze the state of clients’ businesses across various dimensions. Provide reporting and PowerPoint decks that synthesizes data into clear, concise insights and recommendations for senior leadership and relevant teams.
Act as support for specific reporting related to Performance Marketing and its correlation with eRetail Performance, when applicable.
Desired Skills &amp
column2: Experience

column1: Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite
column2: advanced reporting &amp

column1: Highly developed organizational skills with strong attention to detail and a passion for data analysis.
Proficient knowledge of utilizing automated business analytics and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Google Studio preferred
1+ year(s) experience as an Analyst for an eRetail company or consultant agency preferred
Experience with Amazon Vendor Central or other eRetailer content management tools preferred
Excellent communication (both written and verbal) with strong presentation skills
Agile approach to working independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams
Ability to work well under pressure, be flexible and multi-task in a fast-paced environment
eCommerce is a fast-growing industry and ever evolving – we want you to grow with it! You should possess a strong passion for curiosity, with an eagerness to learn and continuously develop.
University or College degree with a concentration in Economics, Marketing, Finance, Business Administration, Commerce or Mathematics preferred.
About Reprise
Global Leader in Performance Marketing.

We are the world’s largest performance marketing network, with over 3,000 experts across 68 offices in 48 markets. We offer a complete suite of digital crafts designed to deliver customer-centric performance marketing via services including, but not limited to, Strategy, SEO, Paid Search, Social, eCommerce and Content. Inside Sales Representative
to join our head office in Richmond, BC.

Your Deliverables and Responsibilities:

Managing global leads for all products through pre-qualification based on BANT, distribution to appropriate regions, and follow-up of lead conversions
Creating and maintaining written value-based content for commercial and technical proposals
Collaborating with Marketing on the creation of campaigns by providing the perspective of the sales team, value-based content, and recommendations for regional or market segment focus

Researching and developing reports from our industry databases to assist regions on creating a sales focus based on market segment, product, or other factors.
Global collaboration and sharing of significant wins and losses, including the DNA of those deals
Documenting and sharing key competitor activities
Maintain central library of significant RFI/RFP’s and Wenco documented responses
Your Experience, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
University Degree in Mining, or Business from an accredited institution, or equivalent practical experience

5+ years of industry and/or sales
Demonstrated trusted advisor experience working with customers and partners

Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities

Self-motivated with ability to prioritize and execute
Strategic planning skills
Why Join Wenco?
We provide opportunities for career-growth within a fast-scaling company

We offer opportunities for continuous training and paid professional development days to learn the latest technologies
We offer our employees a profit-sharing plan that provides them with the benefits of their hard work

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.

The Bell Mobility team offers the best and latest mobile devices, wireless services and Internet of Things solutions to consumer and business customers, with the top speeds, coverage and reliability on Canada’s Best National Network. We love to innovate, embrace big challenges, and live for the newest technology

Reporting to the Sales Manager, Public Safety and Instant Communications, the Client Executive role is an integral component in driving Bell Business Markets’ Instant Communications (IC) portfolio or products in Government, Commercial and Public Safety markets. You will be part of a national team that works with our Bell Business Market sales channel to promote the IC suite of products and services to Bell’s existing base of corporate clients. You will be responsible for net new clients as well as growing your existing base.
Key Responsibilities
Prospecting and Developing a sales Strategy for new opportunities within the Instant Communication portfolio with a specific focus on selling Mobile Private Networks.
Using solution selling techniques to identify business problems and develop solutions with the support of our engineering and network team
Support and sell alongside BBM Client Executive as assigned
Develop, deliver and lead client proposals and presentations including RFP’s
Attain revenue and profit objectives
Ensuring CRM data accurate and current
Lead negotiations, particularly regarding terms, prices and service quality objectives
Build key relationships within your client organization (CIO, CFO, Director of IT, etc.)
Keep up with industry news, emerging trends, competitive threats, and opportunities to deliver greater value
Engage and influence decision makers within your client organization
Drive the sales cycle from start to close
Minimum Qualifications
5 years+ F2F experience managing large complex accounts in Telecommunications or ICT industry.
A University degree/technical background or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
5 years+ of experience in a technical solution selling role
Have a valid drivers license and willing to travel within your geographic territory
Preferred Qualifications/Competencies
Sales experience in Public Sector and Public Safety accounts
Working knowledge of Sales Force
Solution Selling training certificate
Results-oriented with a strong dedication to attaining sales targets
Demonstrated leadership and experience influencing key decision makers
Demonstrated track record of solution selling for complex, long-term deals

Candidates for this position can expect the hiring process to follow the order below. Please keep in mind that candidates can be declined from the position at any stage of the process. To learn more about someone who may be conducting the interview, find their job title on our team page .

Job Description
GSoft is a fast-growing tech company recognized as one of Canada’s top 100 employers in 2022. See it for yourself (Here)
So, what will your new role look like?

We are looking for a Manager, Channel Sales to lead our Channel Account Managers (CAM) team who are tasked with growing and retaining our existing partners base. The manager will be responsible to exceed the team’s quotas as well as to help the CAM’s exceed their individual quotas. They will also be a contributor to the Channel and Business Development strategy and leading its execution to achieve ambitious revenue objectives. The new Manager will be joining a team of highly motivated channel professionals that take pride in running consultative sales activities and share GSoft’s vision to our clients located across the world. Ideal candidates should possess a solid channel knowledge.
Your Responsibilities And Expectations
Exceed quarterly revenue quotas
Lead and manage a high performing and partner focused team of Channel Account Managers to deliver partner business value and an exceptional partner experience.
Hire, grow and develop a team of passionate, coachable and curious channel sales professionals.
Implement &amp
column2: execute the sales strategy to achieve sales goals, increase sales activities and improve sales-related key performance indicators.

column1: Prioritize, organize and lead key initiatives and tactics that will drive growth
Inspire and coach your team on channel best practices, pipeline management and opportunity management to help them expand within their assigned accounts.
Provide reliable forecast information to the Director of Business Development
Help team members with their career planning and development
Maintain a high level of engagement from your team (Currently at 8.7/10 on the Officevibe scale)
Qualifications
&gt
column2: 2 years of previous channel sales leadership experience in a B2B SAAS environment

column1: You’ve worked as an Channel Account Manager or with channel partners for multiple years and demonstrated an impressive track record
You’re recognized by your peers as an amazing sales coach that fosters a culture of high performance
You’re organized and process oriented and understand why it’s important in a remote work reality
You’re obsessed with data and have a proven track record of success creating, analysing and forecasting CRM’s data
You articulate easily your ideas, numbers and challenges to the leadership team as well as to your team.
You strive in leading 1:1 pipeline reviews, performance reviews &amp
column2: growth discussions.

column1: Thrives in a fast-paced, high growth and rapidly changing environment.
Ideally, you’re comfortable with Salesforce, Outreach, Gong &amp
column2: Microsoft.

column1: Additional Information

At GSoft, we build together, we trust each other, and we support each other in success or failure. You will be able to express yourself, evolve and develop your creativity in an environment that will adapt to your daily life and your needs.
We strive to create a healthy and inclusive work environment. This is everyone’s business.

Phone Screen - Virtual Interview using Microsoft Teams - Work Sample - Job Offer
We are looking forward to getting to know you!

The Regional Sales Manager (RSM) is responsible for the overall sales management, support and guidance of the Sales Engineers. 91,2886980830,Technical Sales Engineer,Full-time,Mid-Senior level,FlowPoint Technologies Ltd.,Financial Services,Toronto, ON","
Nurture your passion to pioneer.

We are FlowPoint Technologies Ltd., and we exist to make loan compliance and data management look easy with a platform that converges all of the files between lenders and borrowers to a single location. Instead of letting companies struggle to locate sensitive files between multiple cloud accounts and overflowing desktop folders, FlowPoint allows businesses to focus energies on what matters – their business.

And yes, we make it look like magic, but it’s not. It takes a terrific team of like-minded professionals who are fueled by working on the razor’s edge in data analytics, machine learning, and business intelligence. Why? Because we’re building a simple software solution for a big problem – and that takes brainpower. We have a passion to pioneer the next generation of loan monitoring and compliance, and we are constantly building out new products that keep us ahead of the curve and the competition. We believe in empowering our teammates with the tools, mentorship, and support to take document-sharing from being a burden to being a breeze.

One of our greatest strengths is having true direction and purpose – we’re not trying to be a jack of all trades, we want to be the master of one. With a C-Suite stacked full of industry veterans that know the ropes of the startup world, we have the freedom and confidence to bring our great ideas to life without any of the mishaps that come with inexperience. Together, we will create change that truly benefits our clients in a space that is yet untouched by the fintech industry.
What You’ll Get By Joining Our Team
You will create change.

You will be trusted with some of the most important and impactful work of your career. At FlowPoint you own what you do and you have all the freedom to take on real responsibility at scale and make your mark in the fintech industry. Your brave new ideas will be heard by an audience with open arms and an upper management team that respects your value and your time. From setting you up with your own work-from-home office to buying you subscriptions for certifications and upskilling – whatever it is you need to improve yourself and feel good about what you do, simply ask and you’ll receive. It’s an investment in your future and ours.
You will converge great ideas.

You may never find another startup that takes collective learning as seriously as we do. On a weekly basis, you will share, collaborate and mentor with other great minds in our code kata’s – learning sessions where we nerd out and showcase new platforms, tools, software, and coding best-practices to one another. You are joining a small but rapidly growing team which means you’re entering on the ground-level and getting serious facetime with seasoned champions who have already spent decades building and selling successful businesses.
You will conquer the competition.

Have you ever wanted to do something really big? Us too. And we don’t mess around. At FlowPoint you’ll only be using top-of-the-line tech and modern development stacks to get the job done. You will be a market leader in streamlining finance relationships through technology. FlowPoint services a group whose needs are known but often ignored
column2: it is a jack of no trades, master of one – as such, you will always know exactly what you’re doing and what it takes to get there. Let your ambitions be energized. And hey, we’re all human here. You’re pioneering a first-of-its-kind solution, so if you need to take a minute to slow down, catch your breath, and regroup, then you go take care of yourself, no questions asked.

column1: Perks and Benefits
A C-Suite with strong technical backgrounds and plenty of mentorship capacity
A fully-equipped home office setup
Equity in the company
Free subscriptions to countless certification programs
Pioneering tech for a problem the market hasn’t addressed

“We value an open culture, communication, constant learning where people aren’t afraid to come out and share ideas and problems, discuss and solve them. Openness and transparency are where we create higher performing teams and overall alignment.”
- Brad Johnson, Director of Product
What You'll Do

The Technical Sales Engineer will help sell and support FlowPoint in our target market. You will have a full understanding of all technical aspects of our product and provide post-sales support where needed. As a technical sales engineer you may attend events, meet with clients, and liaise with product engineers. You will be encouraged to make product improvement recommendations and help validate delivery of new features and functions.

We are searching for a detail-oriented, professional, technical sales engineer to join our team. You will be responsible for delivering product demonstrations, networking with clients, expanding sales territories, attending (web) seminars and (on-line) trade exhibitions, conducting market research, increasing your knowledge of technical products, and providing training to customers and their staff. You should continually strive to deliver excellent customer support and make appropriate suggestions for improvement.
We are looking for someone who is a self-starter with superb networking abilities, research skills, and a good eye for market opportunities.
Responsibilities
Conduct market research and obtaining feedback from clients to improve existing products.
Writing reports and liaising with the engineering team regarding issues, foreseeable problems, and effective solutions.
Simplifying technical terms during product demonstrations and post-sales customer support.
Build and maintain strong professional relationships with clients.
Expand current sales market.
Validate SaaS billing, updating orders when needed and helping to negotiate the best contract terms.
Listen to customers’ needs and advise them on the best practice uses of our product and its capabilities.
Requirements
5+ years in a technical sales or pre-sales role in a Saas environment.
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, computer science, business or similar.
Strong customer service, analytical, and interpersonal skills.
Excellent organizational, research, and multitasking abilities.
Strong communication skills in both written and verbal form.
Added Bonuses
Prior experience working in the finance sector would be advantageous.
Prior experience working for SaaS and software engineering companies.
Prior contract negotiation experience.
What to expect when you apply:
As much as we'd love to be able to speak with everyone that applies, only those selected to move forward in our process will be contacted within 5 business days of applying.

FlowPoint is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are given consideration regardless of race, religion, colour, gender, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, marital status, citizenship status, disability, veteran status, or any other protected class as provided in applicable employment laws. FlowPoint also values the diversity and inclusion of the people it hires and serves. We believe in fostering a workplace in which individual differences are recognized, appreciated, respected and responded to in ways that fully develop and utilize each person’s talents and strengths. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at careers (at) FlowPoint(dot) co.

What Will You Do?

We are seeking an accomplished Major Enterprise Account Manager to join our growing Sales organization in the Toronto, Canada metro area. In this role you will act as a trusted advisor to C-levels within a list of 3-4 major enterprise accounts to achieve business revenue goals.
Arista appeals to forward-thinking organizations that value quality and innovation. Consequently, technical acumen and a track record of selling data center solutions is highly desirable.
Job Responsibilities:

Exceed measurable sales objectives and extend the Arista brand within 3-4 major enterprise accounts in the Toronto metro area. You may also be tasked with also developing new white space major accounts.

You will be responsible for utilizing a consultative selling approach with C-level and VP level stakeholders to address the business needs of hybrid cloud computing and siloed legacy IT systems across the Arista product portfolio including our Leaf-Spine Switches, EOS (Award winning open source network OS),Data Center and Cognitive Campus Networking solutions including our Wifi cloud based solutions, Cloud Vision (Network Automation &amp
column2: Telemetry), NDR and Endpoint security solutions.

column1: Meet with key influencers, decision-makers, and C-levels to present Arista’s value proposition.
Work with Arista systems engineers to design and position compelling solutions that drive down the total cost of ownership.
Collaborate with technology partners to identify prospects and demonstrate best-in-class solutions
Establish and manage key channel relationships in your territory.
Formulate strategic and tactical account plans based on periodic business reviews with your prospects and customers.
Conduct demand generation activities such as happy hours, lunch-n-learns and technology forums.
Collaborate with Arista peers on marketing plans and best practices.
Keep up-to-date with technology partner solutions, competing solutions and competitor strategies.
The Team

This position will typically report to a Regional Sales Director or Regional VP of Sales. You will be part of a team that includes the best field engineers in the cloud networking industry. And, you will have the support of our industry-leading Arista TAC, proof-of-concept resources and executive team.
Qualifications
Who Are You?

We are seeking a Sales leader who possesses a hunter mentality and has a proven track record of technology sales including cultivating relationships with existing Global 2000 accounts. You are an influencer and possess the ability to act as a trusted advisor to deliver business value to both end users and key business stakeholders.
Our team looks for individuals who are passionate about disrupting the status quo and embody our values of trust, compassion, collaboration, respectfulness, integrity, and good-natured fun.
Minimum Job Requirements:
BS/BA degree or equivalent in addition to 10+ years of technology sales experience.
Proven track record of direct selling into Global 2000 (Major) accounts within the assigned territory and exceeding sales targets
You posses the ability to lead cross functional teams in the pursuit and capture of multi-million dollars sales deals at the C-level.
You possess relevant data center or networking (LAN/WAN, SDN) industry background from a technology partner, competitor, channel partner or end user is a a requirement.
Strong rolodex and relationships within the territory
Excellent people skills and ability to build relationships at all levels
You possess previous selling experience and technical acumen in one or more of the following areas
column2: Networking, SDN, NFV, Switching, Network Automation, Routing, Data Center, Edge Computing, Network Virtualization, Hyper-converged infrastructure or Cloud computing.

column1: Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Description

This is an amazing opportunity for a veteran Affiliate Marketing Manager who loves being strategic and leading accounts. If you are a super-connector in the B2B or B2C space and you are the best-in-the-world at tapping into new opportunities while ensuring we make the right connections for our clients then this could be the perfect role for you.
Who Are We?

All Inclusive Marketing is a leading performance marketing agency offering strategically customized solutions and award-winning expertise in channels such as affiliate, search, social and content as well as strategic consulting and services. Our vision is to set the standard of excellence in affiliate program management worldwide.

We believe in leading with ethics and innovation to provide the highest level of results and performance marketing expertise for our clients. We are passionate about helping our clients reach, engage, and convert their buyers and affiliate partners to drive accelerated growth through new customer acquisition, incremental revenue buyer retention, loyalty, engagement, and brand presence.

Our team is made up of award-winning experts, who are passionate about all things digital marketing with special attention to affiliate and performance-based marketing. Our team is extremely supportive of one another. When one person succeeds, we all succeed, and we have each other’s backs to help make that happen.
Working with us will provide you with the opportunity to work with amazing clients and with thought leaders and experts in the performance and digital marketing industry.
What are the Key Points?
Competitive Compensation
Location: 100% Remote (virtual team of 30+)
Benefits: Health/Dental/Vision/Disability/Life + 401k, Laptop, Mobile Phone, Office Expense Stipend and Unlimited Time Off
Personality: Fun-loving, Easy Going, Honest, Flexible, Team Player and Obsessed with Details

If you’re a veteran affiliate marketing manager with A LOT of gas still left in the tank and LOVE every aspect of landing super-affiliates that can make it rain, PLUS you crave the opportunity to make an impact working with a team that’s leaning into a meaningful mission, and…
You LOVE to negotiate the deals …
You LOVE brainstorming and pitching fresh new channels that explore new opportunities…
You LOVE getting your hands dirty and jumping on the phone or video calls to build new relationships…
You LOVE working in a fast-paced team environment…
You LOVE building and cultivating relationships and have a continuous appetite to learn more…
… and if the answers to all these points were “YES” then please read on as you’re an ideal fit and we’d love to talk to you ASAP!

Note: We have developed a unique, in-depth application process to help us pinpoint the best candidates. We read every application and will be in touch if there is a good fit. The more you tell, the deeper an understanding we gain and the more meaningful our first conversation will be.
What Are Your Major Objectives?

In a key client-facing position, the Senior Affiliate Account Manager, within our Performance (Affiliate) Marketing Division, will be responsible for driving new customer acquisition and profitable sales growth through team leadership, strategic thinking and process execution for their performance marketing programs. This will include driving the team to deliver on AIM and industry best practices around affiliate recruitment, activation, optimization, compliance, and reporting.

Execute on day-to-day operations of multiple affiliate programs
column2: including publisher recruitment, activation, optimization, compliance, and reporting.

Additional responsibilities as assigned

Experience in managing a team
