Sonic Incytes believes in creating accessible and affordable healthtech solutions – with health insights you can count on – to improve patient care.

Recognizing the rise of chronic liver disease, Sonic Incytes is on a mission to make liver health a new vital sign. Its novel, point of care ultrasound solution, Velacur™, is redefining the standard of care in quantifying liver tissue stiffness and attenuation to aid in the clinical management of patients with chronic liver disease.
Sonic Incytes is seeking a
full-time Marketing and Communications Manager,

who works collaboratively with the sales, product, and operations teams to define Sonic Incytes’ value proposition, generate quality sales leads and build out a comprehensive marketing and communications strategy that supports Sonic Incytes’ strategic and business goals. In addition, the Manager supports the development and implementation of Sonic Incytes’ corporate communications strategy to support our corporate vision, build our corporate reputation, and foster engagement among internal and external stakeholders (i.e. employees, investors, partners).
The Marketing &amp
column2: Communications Manager has strong marketing and communications experience and excellent writing skills, with previous experience writing in the healthcare, medical device, or life sciences industries.

129,2945575676,Lead Estimator,Full-time,,Norseman Structures,,Saskatoon, SK","

Norseman Structures has been in the protection and shelter business for over 100 years, starting with the fabrication of outfitter and exploration tents in the 1920s. Today we deliver a wide variety of ShelterSolutions to customers in virtually every industry, in a variety of climates, anywhere in the world.
We are looking to add a
Lead Estimator

to our team in Saskatoon. Reporting to the Director, Projects the incumbent will be responsible for leading the proposals group in the creation of budgets, estimates and proposals to address the needs and requirements of new and existing clients.

Excellent communication skills as well as the ability to build relationships, with both internal and external stakeholders, is critical in this role. With internal stakeholders, the incumbent will work closely with our Sales and Marketing, Construction, Engineering and Detailing groups to ensure proposals are created accurately and in accordance with customer requirements. Tight timelines are often involved when creating proposals. Building and maintaining relationships with subcontractors and suppliers will also be key when obtaining estimates and information to be included in our proposals.

The incumbent will have previous construction estimation experience and an interest in leading an estimating function. Strong attention to detail skills are required when creating and submitting accurate proposals. The ability to work closely with others in a team environment to identify constructability issues and potential resolutions is essential. Experience with general contracting in an industrial setting would be considered an asset.

If you are a collaborative individual who is looking for a fast paced and dynamic estimating opportunity, please visit our website at www.norsemanstructures.com/about-us/careers/ to learn more! Please submit your cover letter and resume by March 14. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

130,2955732966,Product Marketing Manager (Remote Canada),Full-time,Associate,PointClickCare,Software Development and Hospitals and Health Care,Canada,

PointClickCare is the leading North American cloud-based healthcare software for the acute and long-term and post-acute care markets. For over 20 years, the company has held the same vision – to help the world care for vulnerable populations. Since its inception, PointClickCare has grown exponentially with over 1,700 employees today all working towards impacting the lives of millions. Recognized by Forbes as one of the Top 100 Private Cloud Companies and acknowledged by Waterstone Human Capital as Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture, PointClickCare leads the way in creating cloud-based software.

With its recent acquisition of Collective Medical, PointClickCare solidifies its position as a high growth healthcare software provider, serving over 21,000 long-term and post-acute care providers and over 1,300 hospitals. Their shared mission to support vulnerable populations is allowing PointClickCare and Collective Medical to connect disparate points of care at scale faster than anyone else in the market.
For more information on PointClickCare, please connect with us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn.
Position Summary:

Reporting to the Director, Product Marketing, the Product Marketing Manager at PointClickCare is a primary representative from the Marketing team owning go-to-market and new product launch planning and execution.  In this role, you will be the customer-facing subject matter expert responsible for understanding how they relate to customer needs and buying criteria, developing marketing and sales enablement assets and tools to transfer that knowledge to the sales channel, and supporting prospect education and lead generation/nurture programs.

In addition to working with the Marketing team, you will regularly collaborate cross-functionally (Sales, Product Management, Customer Success and others). It is a balancing act that requires strong diplomatic skills, including knowing when to push back and when to dive in.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop product positioning, value propositions and messaging that resonate with the buying audience and product the source messaging blueprint or positioning guide
Lead product introduction/launch planning including development and measurement of KPIs
Collaborate with marketing peers to drive development of a variety of content including sales decks, solution sheets, customer references, thought leadership and campaign assets
Product launch -  support the launch of new products and releases, defining product positioning, unique sales propositions as well as scoping and creating the required tools and collateral.
Assist in product naming by providing market, competitive and customer context
Create the competitive comparison guide for use in positioning against similar offerings from other organizations.
Sales enablement - communicate the value proposition of the products to the sales team and develop the sales tools that support the selling process of PointClickCare’s solutions.
Market intelligence/customer insight – be the expert on our customers, how/why they buy and their buying criteria, regulatory considerations, etc., with particular focus on different segment demands.
Align closely with members of product management team to facilitate the appropriate flow of information between the teams.
Develop and continuously enhance an expertise of PointClickCare’s products and services in order to construct and convey industry-leading use case scenarios.

Work collaboratively with internal sales and marketing teams to educate them on ways to concisely demonstrate the strengths and features of our products and enhancements to both existing and prospective customers.
Experienced in building consensus, collaborating with cross groups to get things done.
Act as key Subject Matter Expert (SME) supporting complex sales inquiries, customer-facing product education and roadmap updates.
Work with marketing programs, brand management, and digital marketing teams to ensure that appropriate product themes are communicated to the market.
Develop, enhance, and own distribution of public-facing product launch marketing materials.
Collaborate with the sales team in complex sales situations. Proactively communicate to sales with clear value propositions, messaging and tools to leverage in sales scenarios.
Publicly convey product and market strengths via blogs, presentations and webinars.
Provide guidance to marketing teams on themes for programs and events, ensuring they are equipped with content to deliver to customers/prospects.
Partner with Sales Enablement team to lead sales training on new products/capabilities, including regular updates on product enhancements.
Work with customers in developing case studies, references, and testimonials.
Polished professional with an enthusiastic attitude who thrives in fast-paced environments, with an ability to adapt to change.
Required Experience:
Bachelor degree
column2: advanced degree in business or marketing or equivalent experience desirable

column1: 4-6 years in product marketing experience

Experience with Product Management and/or Product Marketing principles such as Practical Product Management or Pragmatic Marketing.  Certification in Pragmatic Marketing or SiriusDecisions Product marketing a plus.
Experience with healthcare technology or B2B SaaS preferred
Industry experience in the segment a definite asset
Strong written and verbal communications skills, from writing collateral and web copy to presentations that deliver business concepts and moderately technical concepts to a diverse audience-base
Knowledge of marketing principles and practices
Excellent time management, interpersonal, communication, decision making, and organization skills
A “roll up the sleeves” attitude
column2: a self-starting orientation with the intense drive to “make things happen""

About Us

Airbase is the first all-in-one spend management platform that provides companies unparalleled control and visibility into every dollar spent. Finance teams deserve a solution that eliminates the tedious work involved in managing spend and allows them to focus on being strategic partners to the rest of the business. We do that by replacing the multiple systems typically used to manage spend with a single platform that handles every workflow including expense approvals and payments (physical cards, virtual cards, ACH, check), while also automating away the bulk of spend-related accounting. Learn more about why innovative companies like Gusto, Segment, Doximity, Getaround, Netlify, and more trust Airbase at www.airbase.com
About The Job

We’re looking for a Product Marketing Specialist to focus on product launches, competitive intelligence and enablement. This role will report to the Director of Product Marketing and work closely with the Marketing, Product, and Sales Enablement teams. The position is full-time and remote, with at least 4 hours per day in ET working hours.
What You'll Do

Own the go-to-market launch process for new products and key components of the Airbase platform, providing strategy, messaging, and coordinating structured launches that drive adoption and sales success. Through this process ensure alignment with cross-functional teams from Product Management, Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, and more.
Develop a deep understanding of the Airbase product and features, act as the subject matter expert on key areas of the product.
Provide messaging, value propositions, benefits, and material to support marketing and sales programs.
Be the subject matter expert (SME) on our product and key competitors’ products, business, sales, and marketing strategies.
Develop, manage, and maintain product comparison tables, lists, and supporting content highlighting product differentiators.
Analyze competitive information on websites, marketing materials, analyst reports, 3rd party review sites, and pricing/packaging.
Create and regularly share executive summaries to ensure Product Marketing, Marketing, Sales Enablement, and Product teams are abreast of the latest information.
Collaborate with Marketing, Product, and Sales Enablement teams to help inform and drive competitive take-out strategies.
Participate in webinars, conferences, and follow the latest industry developments. Follow our competitor’s strategy and tactics, and identify strategic opportunities to pursue.
Execute competitive win/loss reviews with Sales and Partner teams to ensure a clear understanding of competitive dynamics.
Support the creation of marketing content, competitive intelligence, and additional research projects as needed.
What You'll Bring
MBA from a top business school preferred.
2+ years of experience in a research or product marketing role.
Relevant work experience or education in SaaS software, strategy consulting or field-facing competitive intelligence.
Strong communication skills, with the proven ability to translate complex technical concepts into actionable field guidance and differentiated positioning.
Ability to learn new skills quickly and comfortable working with various technologies and interfaces.
A maniacal focus on meeting deadlines and producing tangible results.
Attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and within a team.
Strong program management skills. Highly cross-functional, detail-oriented, with the ability to partner with different stakeholders and teams across the company.
Self-starter with the ability to succeed in high-growth, fast-paced environments.
We offer competitive cash compensation and equity. We're a remote team and are happy to work with candidates from anywhere in the world.

Introduction

As Avenue’s Growth Marketer, you will be responsible for our marketing strategy with a specific focus on improving demand/lead generation and creating lasting first impressions. You will use your strong analytical skillset to review past data, monthly/annual targets, market data, and available marketing budget information to create future growth strategies.

Forget being just a cog in a machine, life at Avenue means making changes on a team, company, and industry level. We encourage testing out new ideas, bringing your knowledge and experience to the table, and making this role your own.

Our products are a necessity to any realtor looking to efficiently run and grow their business, your role at Avenue will therefore centre around creating that awareness and generating a high volume of leads who will become new long-term clients.
We’d love for you to join us on this journey as we transform Avenue from a growing tech startup, into a household name.
What You'll Do
Help Avenue hit revenue and growth targets through successful ownership of the marketing strategy in collaboration with the Director of Sales &amp
column2: Marketing.

column1: Drive performance improvements across all growth channels, including Facebook and Instagram ads, Google ads, email marketing, referrals, SEO/SEM, and organic social media.
Define, measure, analyze, and report on marketing KPIs for the revenue team. Create and maintain dashboards to demonstrate continuous progress against those KPIs.
Work as the system administrator for Hubspot Marketing to ensure it’s fully optimized and the single source of truth for all marketing-related data.
Work closely with teams across Avenue to ensure a consistent and optimized brand voice and online presence.
Support our in-person channels (conferences, presentations, and webinars) ensuring we generate and capture leads effectively. This may include occasional conference travel (2-3 times a year).
Participate in cross-functional group projects aimed at helping Avenue achieve its annual goals while giving everyone in the company the opportunity for personal development.
About You
You have 3-5+ years of digital B2B marketing experience, preferably with a SaaS company.
You are adept at managing Facebook and Instagram ads, Google ads, email marketing, organic social media, and SEO/SEM with a track record of running successful campaigns (i.e., measurable ROI).
You are an expert at creating marketing-based reports and dashboards.
You have excellent attention to detail (spelling, grammar, formatting, data analysis).
You are comfortable working both independently and with a dynamic mix of individuals and teams depending on the goal.
Bonus Points
Experience in Real Estate or working with Realtors.
Experience writing copy.
Experience with Hubspot.
Key Competencies
For The Growth Marketer Role, These Are

Avenue uses a competency-based approach to all People Operations, and this includes hiring. Competencies are broad qualities that lead to success in a role and within a career path. They’re the amalgamation of behaviours, skills, experience and ability. At Avenue, our competency framework is made up of 9 individual competencies, which stretch across all roles. However, each role has 3-4 key competencies that are essential to success in that role.
Understanding Context
Decision Making
Communication
Problem Solving

In the interview stage of this hiring process, the questions will be specifically based on each of these key competencies. Ahead of that interview, we will provide more information about our framework and key competencies to enable you to prepare sufficiently.
Our Hiring Process

Avenue firmly believes in the value of a diverse and inclusive workplace where people come together to learn and grow. We welcome applicants of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. As a company, we are working to provide equal opportunities and a supportive work environment for all.
Applying For This Position
At this time, this role is only open to candidates with a home base aligned with PT/MT/CT/ET timezones (our roots are in Vancouver, BC, Canada).
Please submit your resume and a cover letter via our job posting on secure.collage.co/jobs/avenuehq/29109
Applications will be accepted until midnight on March 27th, 2022. We will then review all applications and reach out to successful applicants to arrange interviews within 5 business days.
Successful Applicants Will Then Enter The Following Interview Process
Phone screen with the hiring manager. This is an informal conversation to learn a little about you and provide more information about the role and Avenue.
Competency-based panel interviews with 3 members of Avenue’s team (including one representative from Avenue’s internal DEI council).
Reference check
Compensation And Benefits
Annual salary of $60k-$70k commensurate with experience.
Generous equity package.

Great benefits delivered through League.com’s digital platform, giving you flexibility, choice and control. Extended coverage for both medical and dental, plus your own lifestyle (gym, workout gear, ski pass, etc.) and health spending accounts (massage, chiropractor, glasses, etc.)
The right tools for the job (Macbook + accessories, monitor, $500 home office stipend, $40/month internet allowance).
Flexible hours and unlimited vacation (at Avenue you work when it makes the most sense for you and your team).
About Avenue

Avenue is a distributed, fully remote organization. We transitioned to this way of working in 2020 (like everyone else!) but haven’t looked back since and plan to remain so permanently. Asynchronous communication and flexible hours let us schedule our days so we work when we do our best work without missing out on life’s important moments.

Avenue grew out of a need we saw in the real estate industry. All of the REALTORS® we knew put in hours of screen time each week online, trying to manage the many moving parts that made up their personal marketing. They wanted to attract new clients, but they weren’t getting the results they wanted.

As a team of marketers, engineers, and designers, we saw how our respective skill sets could work together to solve their problem. We could give Realtors what they’d never had before: The chance to market themselves online, and stand out—supported by the knowledge and tools only a team of experts could provide.

Today Avenue offers realtors through North America a beautiful semi-custom website aligned with their brand, lead capture tools, lite-CRM, online advertising management and a monthly email newsletter. Giving our clients access to a complete online marketing strategy that was previously only available through high-cost agencies.
